description: Sent when the protection group changes
operational status.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtOperStatusBothDown LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtIndex u 9999 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtName s EXAMPLE

description: An arbitrary index assigned to each entry.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtIndex

description: The name of the object, for example
'pg:1:2:1-2:1:3:1-2', where the numbers indicate the
subrack, slot and TX-RX port number for the left and
right interface of the group.
The interface is either a client interface
or a line interface. This depends on the
protection type, which in turn depends on
the type of board that is involved.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtName

description: Sent when the protection group changes
operational status.

event.Summary: Protection group $v2 status: left down, right up

description: An arbitrary index assigned to each entry.

description: Sent when the laser of the interface is turned
on.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfLaserStatusOn LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfIndex u 9999 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfName s EXAMPLE LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfLaserStatusLastChangeTime s EXAMPLEE

description: An arbitrary index assigned to each if entry.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfIndex

description: The management name of the interface, for example
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfName

description: The time when the laser status was last changed.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfLaserStatusLastChangeTime

description: Sent when the laser of the interface is turned
off.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfLaserStatusOff LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfIndex u 9999 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfName s EXAMPLE LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfLaserStatusLastChangeTime s EXAMPLEE

description: An arbitrary index assigned to each if entry.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfIndex

description: The management name of the interface, for example
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfName

description: The time when the laser status was last changed.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmIfLaserStatusLastChangeTime

description: Sent when the protection group changes
operational status.

event.Summary: Protection group $v2 status: $v3 side is active; left $v4, right $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtStatusChanged LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtIndex u 9999 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtName s EXAMPLE LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtActiveSide i 1 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtLeftStatus i 1 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtRightStatus i 1 LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtLastChangeTime s EXAMPLEE

description: An arbitrary index assigned to each entry.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtIndex

description: The name of the object, for example
'pg:1:2:1-2:1:3:1-2', where the numbers indicate the
subrack, slot and TX-RX port number for the left and
right interface of the group.
The interface is either a client interface
or a line interface. This depends on the
protection type, which in turn depends on
the type of board that is involved.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtName

description: The operational state for the protection group.
none - no side is active.
left - the left side is active.
right - the right side is active.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtActiveSide

description: The operational state for the left side of the
protection group.
down - this side is out of service.
up - this side is active.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtLeftStatus

description: The operational state for the right side of
the protection group.
down - this side is out of service.
up - this side is active.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtRightStatus

description: The time the operational state of the protection
group was last changed.
variables.name: LUM-WDM-MIB::wdmProtLastChangeTime
